page.title: 10Geography -Calverton (cont)
page.content: Settlement areas included two growing towns Stony Stratford and Deanshanger, two villages -Beachampton and Calverton -comprising Lower Weald,Middle Weald, Upper Weald and one hamlet called Passenham.Roads -The only major road was the A422 which passed through Deanshanger.The B4033 linked Stony Stratford and Beachampton.There were two other minor roads,one linking the B4033 with the A422 going through Passenham and the other leading from B4033 near Stony Stratford through Calverton.The three farms in our area-Mount Mill Farm,Mill Farm,Hill Farm.Boundaries-The county boundary separating Buckinghamshire and Northamptonshire follows the River Great Ouse through our area.The district boundary separating Milton Keynes from the Buckingham district also runs through our area.
